thread.title: Dow, S&P 500 fall on oil-sector weakness
thread.title_full: Dow, S&P 500 fall on oil-sector weakness

title: Dow, S&P 500 fall on oil-sector weakness
text:
View Photo 

Weakness in petroleum-linked equities weighed down the Dow and the S&P 500 Friday following poor earnings from ExxonMobil and Chevron (Swiss: CVX.SW - news ) and a drop in oil prices. 
At the closing bell, the Dow Jones Industrial Average stood at 17,695.11, down 49.87 points (0.28 percent). 
The broad-based S&P 500 fell 3.83 (0.18 percent) to 2,104.80, while the tech-rich Nasdaq Composite Index added a scant 1.87 (0.04 percent) at 5,130.65. 
Dow component ExxonMobil shed 4.6 percent after reporting net income fell by 52.3 percent year-over-year to $4.2 billion in the second quarter. Chevron lost 4.9 percent as it reported about a 90 percent drop in profits to just $571 million. 
But the pain to petroleum-oriented equities did not end there. Drilling company Nabors Industries (NYSE: NBR - news ) lost 1.8 percent and producer Marathon Oil shed 3.8 percent after US oil prices dived almost 3.0 percent to close at $47.52 a barrel.
